summary: The Doors were an American rock band formed in 1965 in Los Angeles. The band members were Jim Morrison (vocals), Ray Manzarek (keyboard), Robby Krieger (guitar), and John Densmore (drums). They were very popular and influential in the 1960s, known for Morrison's powerful voice and unique lyrics. The band's name came from a book by Aldous Huxley. They released six studio albums in five years, some of which are considered the best rock albums of all time. After Morrison's death in 1971, the band continued but eventually disbanded. They reunited a few times and have sold over 100 million records worldwide, making them one of the best-selling bands ever.
title: The Doors
